title: What is an event with a probability of 0 called? - Quora

response.answer_text: Probability of 0 is “impossible” - Technically you won’t see this unless the event is really contrived. However in sports you will definitely see events with 0 probability late in the season where teams will not have enough points to win any championships. Probability of 1 is “certain” - Again, this is rare, unless you are talking about something that is happening “now” or something that has happened in the past. Taking the championship example again, if someone has enough points that they cannot be beaten in the games left they have a probability of 1 that they are champion, even if the awarding of the title hasn’t happened yet. In most cases an event will lie somewhere above 0 and below 1.

If I roll a normal six sided die… The probability of getting a number in this list 1,2,3,4,5,6 is six chances out of six which is of course equal to 1. This is called a CERTAINTY. ——————————————————————————————————— The probability of getting a number 7 is zero chances out of six which is ZERO. This is called an IMPOSSIBILITY. ——————————————————————————————————- Note: You can’t say “a probability of zero is impossible” because it is possible to get a probability of zero. I hope you see the difference!
